SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: Charles Edward Rose
2. Your address: Amulet, SW 31-7-24A or Rainville, Sask.
3. Date: March 10, 1962
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): Union St. Apple, 28th England
5. What was your father's name and occupation? George Jesse Dry Goods, Breeder
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): March 1914
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible: Southampton, Hampshire & Sandhurst, London, All England
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.): 42
9. What were your reasons for coming West? (In Saskatchewan):
   - Come to get rich
   - Family shipped off to there
   - Work as working friends
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?):
    - Railroads
    - But London black glass display (beautiful)
    - Joint Canadian Money Police Traveling Advertising Agency
    - You earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you come?
    - Traveling Shoe Company, Western agent
    - Good clipping, handwriting for New Tatamy

11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?
   Not at all good, rather.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?
   My wife, two small sons age 2 & 4.

13. What means of transportation did you use?
   The Great North Railway booked me through steam boat & Railway to Edmonton. (Now defunct.)
   9½ age train was fast up hotel to good passage long waiting line. Way stop, turned slowly after I arrived.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)
   Have met a few no Indians only a few Indians.
   My friends & neighbors told me I had been fortunate, had to have been educated once.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?
   Came straight to Amisked. Family stopped off for two weeks at Wainwright, friends.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?
   As Amisked, Sask.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.
   None
   Living in amalgamation of leg, blood clot
   Marian Home Radville May 1956

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?
   Farming, store keeping, various ways
   Rock clipping, hardworking for others
   Farming
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?
   - We all thought it was a good idea.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?
   - My wife and I traveled together.

13. What means of transportation did you use?
   - We traveled by train from Ontario to Saskatchewan.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)
   - We encountered many friendly people along the way.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?
   - We stayed at a campsite near the town of Saskatoon.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?
   - We settled in the area around Prince Albert.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.
   - We also lived in Regina for a short time.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?
   - Before coming to Canada, we worked as farmers. After coming, we continued farming.
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?
   Very often, still do.

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.
   Mrs. Baxter, Hampshire, England, 1909

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommending it as a place to settle?
   No

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.
   No

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?
   I bought a drill from Taylor, my son & I pulled out Taylor & could not see the team until I came back one day a lost drill & spilled neighbors' corn, fellow black their dust.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?
   No
   Church in town around.
   No, I knew no more than that there was it with the idea of buying permanently.
   No, I knew no more than that buying it out? When did you make this decision?
   In a week maybe.
   Buggy done horse.

   \[ \text{answered 2\(\frac{1}{2}\) miles} \]

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.)
   \[ \text{all stores closed} \]

29. How often did you shop in the early days?
   \[ \text{When we shipped goods} \]

30. When (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays?
   \[ \text{Before I can remember} \]

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail order and any changes in the proportion of purchases made by mail order since the pioneer period.
   \[ \text{March 1914} \]
   \[ \text{food, any articles wanted, machinery} \]
   \[ \text{We farmers usually send the proceeds of our first load of wheat to mail order firms} \]

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it?
   \[ \text{about 1916 when poles etc put in Regina} \]

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?
   \[ \text{Yes, permanently} \]

34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1914? What reasons did they have for moving?
   No coming or going States (U.S.)

35. Did many people move away during the 1930's? Did many return?
   Yes, farmers, neighbors, etc.

36. If you or some member of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates wherever possible.
   School Sec. & Wheat Pool comm. Sec.
   My Son Louis was named Wheat Pool Sec. Sec.
